problems.problem: A proton moves with velocity $v = 2 \times 10^6 \, \text{m/s}$ perpendicular to a uniform magnetic field $B = 0.5 \, \text{T}$. Find the magnetic force on the proton.
An electron moves at $3 \times 10^6 \, \text{m/s}$ at $30^\circ$ to a magnetic field $B = 0.2 \, \text{T}$. Find the magnitude of the magnetic force.
A wire carrying a current $I = 5 \, \text{A}$ is placed in a uniform magnetic field $B = 0.3 \, \text{T}$. The wire is 0.2 m long and perpendicular to the field. Find the force on the wire.
A straight conductor of length $L = 0.5 \, \text{m}$ carries $I = 10 \, \text{A}$ in a magnetic field $B = 0.4 \, \text{T}$ at $60^\circ$ to the wire. Find the magnetic force.

A circular loop of radius $r = 0.1 \, \text{m}$ carries a current $I = 2 \, \text{A}$ in a uniform magnetic field $B = 0.3 \, \text{T}$. The plane of the loop is perpendicular to the field. Find the torque on the loop.
A proton moves in a circular path of radius $0.05 \, \text{m}$ under a uniform magnetic field $B = 0.2 \, \text{T}$. Its speed is $2 \times 10^6 \, \text{m/s}$. Find the centripetal force.

An electron moves at $10^6 \, \text{m/s}$ perpendicular to a $B = 0.1 \, \text{T}$ field. Find the radius of its circular path. ($m_e = 9.11 \times 10^{-31} \, \text{kg}, q = 1.6 \times 10^{-19} \, \text{C}$)
A wire of length 0.3 m carries 8 A perpendicular to a magnetic field 0.5 T. Find the magnitude and direction of the force on the wire.

step_by_step.explanation: Use right-hand rule: force is perpendicular to both current and magnetic field.

problems.final_answer: Force: $F = 1.2 \, \text{N}$, perpendicular to both current and magnetic field.

problems.problem: A rectangular loop of wire $0.2 \times 0.1$ m carries 3 A in a uniform field $B = 0.4$ T. The plane of the loop is parallel to the field. Find the torque.
problems.final_answer: Torque: $\tau = 0 \, \text{N m}$ (no torque since loop is parallel to field)

problems.problem: A beam of electrons with speed $v = 2 \times 10^6$ m/s enters a uniform magnetic field $B = 0.1$ T at right angles. Find the period of circular motion. ($m_e = 9.11 \times 10^{-31}$ kg, $q = 1.6 \times 10^{-19}$ C)
